panels.description: If this metric is equal or below 2, it means that at least 75% of the alerts are validated. The validated alerts are shown in the "Alerts" gauge to the right
panels.title: Noise Level

panels.description: Validated alerts. This means that the alert has a status flag < 2 -> Eyer has enough data to do solid anomaly detection
panels.title: Validated Alerts

panels.description: "Validated" means that the alert has a status flag < 2 -> Eyer has enough data to do solid anomaly detection
panels.title: Needs your attention

panels.description: "Validated" means that the alert has a status flag < 2 -> Eyer has enough data to do solid anomaly detection
panels.title: Potential emerging anomalies

panels.description: Only updates are charted. Make sure to adjust the time range to see when last update occured
panels.title: Alert update history for ${GetAlertID}

options.content:
Info on selected alert

AlertId: ${GetAlertID:text}

Nodes affected: ${GetAlertNodesName}
Metrics affected: ${GetAlertMetricsName}

targets.query:
from(bucket: "environment_key/RP_DetectionCorridor")
    |> range(start: v.timeRangeStart, stop: v.timeRangeStop)
    |> filter(fn: (r) => r._measurement == "DetectionCorridor")
    |> filter(fn: (r) => r.stid == "${GetAlertMetricsAndName:value}" and r.nid == "${GetAlertNodes}")
    |> filter(fn: (r) => 
        r["_field"] == "maindown" or 
        r["_field"] == "mainup" or 
        r["_field"] == "c" or 
        r["_field"] == "v" or 
        r["_field"] == "mx" or 
        r["_field"] == "supdown" or 
        r["_field"] == "supup" or 
        r["_field"] == "infup" or 
        r["_field"] == "infdown"
    )
    |> group(columns: ["_time"])
    |> reduce(
        identity: {
            _time: time(v: 0),
            c: 0.0, 
            mx: 0.0, 
            v: 0.0,
            maindown: 0.0, 
            mainup: 0.0, 
            supdown: 0.0, 
            supup: 0.0, 
            infup: 0.0, 
            infdown: 0.0
        },
        fn: (r, accumulator) => ({
            _time: r._time,
            c: if r._field == "c" then r._value else accumulator.c, 
            mx: if r._field == "mx" then r._value else accumulator.mx, 
            v: if r._field == "v" then r._value else accumulator.v,
            maindown: if r._field == "maindown" then r._value else accumulator.maindown,
            mainup: if r._field == "mainup" then r._value else accumulator.mainup,
            supdown: if r._field == "supdown" then r._value else accumulator.supdown,
            supup: if r._field == "supup" then r._value else accumulator.supup,
            infdown: if r._field == "infdown" then r._value else accumulator.infdown,
            infup: if r._field == "infup" then r._value else accumulator.infup
        })
    )
    |> map(fn: (r) => ({ r with avg: r.v / r.c }))
    |> group()
